rationale: This 8-bar arrangement uses triads exclusively (capped jazz_harmony at 3/10) with no 7th chords or functional jazz harmony. The hihat plays exclusively on downbeats (capped latin_jazz_rhythm at 3/10) with no upbeat syncopation. The saxophone melody consists of repetitive scale patterns (jazz_melody 4/10) without phrasing or development. All instruments start playing in bar 1 (interplay_space 4/10) with no progressive build. The arrangement lacks the essential elements of jazz authenticity (4/10), resembling a generic scale exercise rather than a jazz melody. Needs 7th chords, stronger upbeat groove, and proper progressive arrangement.
suggestions: Bar 1: ONLY hihat should play. All other instruments rest.
Bars 2-4: Add snare and bass. Piano and sax still rest.
Bars 5-8: Full ensemble enters with piano 7th chords and memorable sax melody.
Replace ALL piano triads with 7th chords (Cmaj7: C-E-G-B, Dm7: D-F-A-C, G7: G-B-D-F)
Increase hihat upbeat syncopation to >60% (hit more 'and's, skip more downbeats)
prompt_mutation: Emphasize progressive arrangement structure more strongly. Add quantitative requirements: Bar 1 = hihat ONLY, Bars 2-4 = rhythm section ONLY (no piano/sax), Bars 5-8 = full ensemble. Make it impossible to ignore.
